item.title: Every time there is any rain , the road becomes blocked by surface water which has not drained away, 17th January
item.description:
Every time there is any rain , the road becomes blocked by surface water which has not drained away - all this problem needs is a small trench from the road side into the large drain by the hedge - not a big job - if you can’t do it - I can
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 25cm pothole slightly away from kerb, and directly in primary tyre track given narrowness of road. Heavy rainfall and minimal street lighting makes hole impossible to see in the dark. item.title: Potholes and debris in road, 17th January
item.description:
These potholes were apparently 'fixed' yesterday. There are still big holes and lot of debris flying everywhere. The patching already looks like it is broken. Please repair the road properly- the whole area needs cleaning up and tarmacking. Patchwork simply does not fix the issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated flooding at this location. Drain appears not to work, 17th January
item.description:
Drain at the end of the road nearest the Moorend Park Road mini roundabout, on the side of the road beneath tall fir trees Repeated flooding witnessed for last 2 months after rain. Takes days to drain. Sometimes half the road is flooded

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Moorend Grove, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water flowing out of drain, 17th January
item.description:
A435 eastern side. Between 59moh limit and zgotherington cross. Water is flowing out of drain and causing a flood on the road. This is dangerous and will also lead to the road surface beeaking up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing metal cover on drainage deep and wide without any indication of the issue on road, 17th January
item.description:
Outside local convince store I was coming back on bicycle and drive in to the hazard fall off the bike and broke my wrist also luckily car on road stop to let me go fist on the front of me so if we have to face each other probably I would end up under they wheel as when I realised I am falling off the bike car was stopping I have now broken wrist and awaiting trauma orthopaedic appointment at Gloucester royal hospital to check if dislocated bit is needed to be undergoing surgery or if locate back to the place I was told at Cheltenham hospital Rewrite text for me as official report to report issue on public road Here’s a professional rewrite of your incident suitable for an official report on a public road hazard. *** **Incident Report: Bicycle Accident Due to Road Hazard** On Wednesday late evening while cycling from work near local convenience store, I encountered a road hazard which caused me to lose control of my bicycle and fall. As a result of the fall, I sustained a broken wrist. Following the incident, at 3 am I couldn't handle pain in wrist and decided to go to Cheltenham Hospital, where an initial assessment confirmed a wrist fracture. I have since been referred to the Trauma and Orthopaedic Department at Gloucester Royal Hospital for further assessment to determine whether surgery is required to realign the bone. I am submitting this report to notify the relevant authority of the hazardous condition on the public road which directly caused this incident, and to request an urgent inspection and remedial action to prevent similar accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes along this stretch of road. Previous repairs have undone and the road surface is very uneven. item.title: No Priority Ever Given to Green Arrow, 16th January
item.description:
Since the new lights have gone in at Pirton Lane there is very rarely a green right turn arrow coming from Elmbridge Court. This is more important now or Parton Road closure (much better than 5 way lights!) as there are a lot more left turners meaning that the right turners often at peak times blocking the whole CRE back to Heathdean Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pothole on bend towards edge of road, 16th January
item.description:
After the T Junction (heading towards shurdington road), where the road bends round to the left there is quite a large pothole near the edge of the road which is difficult to avoid when there is oncoming traffic.
